newsitem.title: CANADA: Canada board sets hearing on Westcoast tolls.
newsitem.headline: Canada board sets hearing on Westcoast tolls.

text.p: Canada's National Energy Board said on Friday it scheduled a public hearing on new natural gas pipeline, gathering and processing tolls announced by Westcoast Energy Inc on Thursday.

Westcoast announced multi-year incentive toll agreements with the Canadian Assiciation of Petroleum Producers, BC Gas Utility Ltd, Canwest Gas Supply, the Council of Canadian Forest Industries and the Export Users Group.
The NEB said the hearing would start in Vancouver on June 23 and intervenors were to notify the board by June 2.
Westcoast, which operates British Columbia's main gas transportation system, has been operating using interim tolls since the beginning of this year.

The hearing was also set to address the recovery of costs incurred by Westcoast in its Fort St. John and Grizzly Valley gas plant expansion projects, the NEB said. ((Reuters Calgary Bureau (403) 531-1624))
